definition[0]: to succeed in doing something difficult
example[0]: The goalkeeper pulled off six terrific saves.
definition[1]: to drive a car off a road in order to stop, or to turn into a smaller road
example[1]: We pulled off the road to get some food.
example[2]: Applix Inc. pulled off an exclusive $15 million deal with K K Ashisuto.
example[3]: Cobra Beer has pulled off another coup at the awards in Brussels, winning 13 medals for its beers and wines.
